hypothesis_content.title: Post-News Sentiment Reversal on Failed Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: Following a high-impact news event (categorized by Cryptoquant NewsFlow score > 80), if BTC price breaks above its pre-news 4-hour range high (or below range low) by >1.5% within 2 hours, but then closes the 2-hour candle back inside the pre-news range, a fade trade in the direction of the failed breakout (short if failed breakout above, long if failed breakout below) entered at that candle close will be profitable over a 12-hour horizon.
hypothesis_content.rationale: High-impact news often creates emotional, liquidity-driven spikes that exhaust quickly if the fundamental regime hasn't changed. A failure to sustain a breakout suggests the news was already priced in or misinterpreted, leading to a rapid reversal as weak hands exit.
entry_conditions: Cryptoquant NewsFlow score > 80 (event occurs at T0)
Define Pre-News Range: High/Low of 4-hour candle preceding T0
Within 2 hours post-T0: BTC breaks range by >1.5%
The 2-hour candle closing at T0+2 hours has a close price BACK INSIDE the Pre-News Range
Enter at market on close of that T0+2 hour candle

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price returns to the midpoint of the pre-news range
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price moves against entry by 2x the initial breakout magnitude (e.g., if broke 1.5% above range, stop at 3% above range high)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Win rate < 55% or Profit Factor (Gross Profit/Gross Loss) < 1.4 in a backtest across at least 30 signal instances.
